item.title: Point72: ECB to Cut in July, Not September
item.description: Although everyone thinks the next ECB cut will come in September, the data suggests that actually the next cut will come in July says Soeren Radde, Head of Eueopean Economic Research at Point72. Looking more long-term, Radde is positive on Europe, predicting that the 'long game will come'. Radde joined Francine Lacqua on 'Bloomberg: The Pulse'. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Why the ‘TACO’ Trade Is Tempting Investors Amid US-China Talks
item.description: On May 30, US President Donald Trump accused his Chinese counterpart, President Xi Jinping, of breaking a trade truce that brought down tariffs from extreme highs in early May. Investors saw the writing on the wall: tariffs would spike again, hurting the economy. Stocks fell more than 1%. But later the same day, Trump said he’d have a conversation with Xi, and optimism – and stock prices – were restored. When the call finally happened on June 5, the S&P 500 Index again briefly surged.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump, left, and Xi Jinping. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg
